com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport

Interface ConnectOptions


  • public interface ConnectOptions
    UPA Connect Options used in the Transport.connect(ConnectOptions, Error) call.
    See Also:
    Transport

      • unifiedNetworkInfo

        UnifiedNetworkInfo unifiedNetworkInfo()
        Connection parameters when sending and receiving on same network. This is typically used with ConnectionTypes.SOCKET, ConnectionTypes.HTTP, ConnectionTypes.ENCRYPTED, and fully connected/mesh multicast networks.
        Returns:
        the UnifiedNetworkInfo

      • segmentedNetworkInfo

        SegmentedNetworkInfo segmentedNetworkInfo()
        Connection parameters when sending and receiving on different networks. This is typically used with multicast networks that have different groups of senders and receivers (e.g., NIProvider can send network and ADH on receive network).
        Returns:
        the SegmentedNetworkInfo

      • compressionType

        void compressionType(int compressionType)
        The type of compression the client would like performed for this connection. Compression is negotiated between the client and server and may not be performed if only the client has enabled. Must be in the range of CompressionTypes.NONE - CompressionTypes.LZ4.
        Parameters:
        compressionType - the compressionType to set
        See Also:
        CompressionTypes

      • blocking

        void blocking(boolean blocking)
        If set to true, blocking I/O will be used for this Channel. When I/O is used in a blocking manner on a Channel, any reading or writing will complete before control is returned to the application. In addition, the connect method will complete any initialization on the Channel prior to returning it.

        Blocking I/O prevents the application from performing any operations until the I/O operation is completed. Blocking I/O is typically not recommended. An application can leverage an I/O notification mechanism to allow efficient reading and writing, while using other cycles to perform other necessary work in the application. An I/O notification mechanism enables the application to read when data is available, and write when output space is available.

        Parameters:
        blocking - the blocking to set

      • blocking

        boolean blocking()
        If true, the connection will block.
        Returns:
        the blocking

      • pingTimeout

        void pingTimeout(int pingTimeout)
        The clients desired ping timeout value. This may change through the negotiation process between the client and the server. After the connection becomes active, the actual negotiated value becomes available through the pingTimeout value on the Channel. When determining the desired ping timeout, the typically used rule of thumb is to send a heartbeat every pingTimeout/3 seconds. Must be in the range of 1 - 255. If the value is 0, it will be adjusted to 1, and if the value is greater than 255, it will be set to 255.
        Parameters:
        pingTimeout - the pingTimeout to set

      • pingTimeout

        int pingTimeout()
        The clients desired ping timeout value. This may change through the negotiation process between the client and the server. After the connection becomes active, the actual negotiated value becomes available through the pingTimeout value on the Channel. When determining the desired ping timeout, the typically used rule of thumb is to send a heartbeat every pingTimeout/3 seconds.
        Returns:
        the pingTimeout

      • guaranteedOutputBuffers

        void guaranteedOutputBuffers(int guaranteedOutputBuffers)
        A guaranteed number of buffers made available for this Channel to use while writing data. Guaranteed output buffers are allocated at initialization time. Must be in the range of 0 - 2,147,483,647. If the argument value is less then 5, the guaranteed number of buffers will be set to 5.
        Parameters:
        guaranteedOutputBuffers - the guaranteedOutputBuffers to set

      • guaranteedOutputBuffers

        int guaranteedOutputBuffers()
        A guaranteed number of buffers made available for this Channel to use while writing data. Guaranteed output buffers are allocated at initialization time.
        Returns:
        the guaranteedOutputBuffers

      • numInputBuffers

        void numInputBuffers(int numInputBuffers)
        The number of sequential input buffers to allocate for reading data into. This controls the maximum number of bytes that can be handled with a single network read operation. Input buffers are allocated at initialization time. Must be in the range of 0 - 2,147,483,647.
        Parameters:
        numInputBuffers - the numInputBuffers to set

      • numInputBuffers

        int numInputBuffers()
        The number of sequential input buffers to allocate for reading data into. This controls the maximum number of bytes that can be handled with a single network read operation. Input buffers are allocated at initialization time.
        Returns:
        the numInputBuffers. The number must be greater than 0.

      • majorVersion

        void majorVersion(int majorVersion)
        The major version number of the Channel.

        If the UPA Codec package is being used, this should be set to Codec.majorVersion().
        Parameters:
        majorVersion - the majorVersion to set

      • majorVersion

        int majorVersion()
        The major version number of the Channel.
        Returns:
        the majorVersion

      • minorVersion

        void minorVersion(int minorVersion)
        The minor version number of the Channel.

        If the UPA Codec package is being used, this should be set to Codec.minorVersion().
        Parameters:
        minorVersion - the minorVersion to set

      • minorVersion

        int minorVersion()
        The major version of the protocol that the client intends to exchange over the connection. This value is negotiated with the server at connection time. The outcome of the negotiation is provided via the majorVersion information on the Channel. Typically, a major version increase is associated with the introduction of incompatible change. The transport layer is data neutral and does not change nor depend on any information in content being distributed. This information is provided to help client and server applications manage the information they are communicating.
        Returns:
        the minorVersion

      • protocolType

        void protocolType(int protocolType)
        The protocol type that the client intends to exchange over the connection. If the protocolType indicated by a server does not match the protocolType that a client specifies, the connection will be rejected. When a Channel becomes active for a client or server, this information becomes available via the protocolType on the Channel. The transport layer is data neutral and does not change nor depend on any information in content being distributed. This information is provided to help client and server applications manage the information they are communicating.

        If the UPA Codec package is being used, this should be set to Codec.protocolType().
        Parameters:
        protocolType - the protocolType to set

      • protocolType

        int protocolType()
        The protocol type that the client intends to exchange over the connection. If the protocolType indicated by a server does not match the protocolType that a client specifies, the connection will be rejected. When a Channel becomes active for a client or server, this information becomes available via the protocolType on the Channel. The transport layer is data neutral and does not change nor depend on any information in content being distributed. This information is provided to help client and server applications manage the information they are communicating.
        Returns:
        the protocolType

      • userSpecObject

        void userSpecObject(java.lang.Object userSpecObject)
        A user specified object. This value is not modified by the transport, but will be preserved and stored in the userSpecPtr of the Channel returned from connect. This information can be useful for coupling this Channel with other user created information, such as a watch list associated with this connection.
        Parameters:
        userSpecObject - the userSpecObject to set. The object must be non null.

      • userSpecObject

        java.lang.Object userSpecObject()
        A user specified object. This value is not modified by the transport, but will be preserved and stored in the userSpecPtr of the Channel returned from connect. This information can be useful for coupling this Channel with other user created information, such as a watch list associated with this connection.
        Returns:
        the userSpecObject

      • tcpOpts

        TcpOpts tcpOpts()
        A substructure containing TCP based connection type specific options. These settings are used for ConnectionTypes.SOCKET, ConnectionTypes.HTTP, and ConnectionTypes.ENCRYPTED.
        Returns:
        the tcpOpts
        See Also:
        TcpOpts

        See Also:

      • shmemOpts

        ShmemOpts shmemOpts()
        Shared memory transport specific options (used by ConnectionTypes.UNIDIR_SHMEM).

      • sysSendBufSize

        void sysSendBufSize(int sysSendBufSize)
        The size (in kilobytes) of the system's send buffer used for this connection, where applicable. Setting of 0 indicates to use default sizes. This can also be set or changed via Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error). Must be in the range of 0 - 2,147,483,647.
        Parameters:
        sysSendBufSize - the sysSendBufSize to set

      • sysSendBufSize

        int sysSendBufSize()
        The size (in kilobytes) of the system's send buffer used for this connection, where applicable. Setting of 0 indicates to use default sizes. This can also be set or changed via Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error).
        Returns:
        the sysSendBufSize

      • sysRecvBufSize

        void sysRecvBufSize(int sysRecvBufSize)
        The size (in kilobytes) of the system's receive buffer used for this connection, where applicable. Setting of 0 indicates to use default sizes. This can also be set or changed via Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error) for values less than or equal to 64K. For values larger than 64K, you must use this method so that sysRecvBufSize will be set prior to the connect system call. Must be in the range of 0 - 2,147,483,647.
        Parameters:
        sysRecvBufSize - the sysRecvBufSize to set

      • sysRecvBufSize

        int sysRecvBufSize()
        The size (in kilobytes) of the system's receive buffer used for this connection, where applicable. Setting of 0 indicates to use default sizes. This can also be set or changed via Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error) for values less than or equal to 64K.
        Returns:
        the sysRecvBufSize

      • seqMCastOpts

        SeqMCastOpts seqMCastOpts()
        Sequenced Multicast transport specific options (used by ConnectionTypes.SEQUENCED_MCAST).
        Returns:
        the SeqMCastOpts
        See Also:
        SeqMCastOpts

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears UPA Connect Options.

      • copy

        int copy(ConnectOptions destOpts)
        This method will perform a deep copy into the passed in parameter's members from the ConnectOptions calling this method.
        Parameters:
        destOpts - the value getting populated with the values of the calling ConnectOptions
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, TransportReturnCodes.FAILURE if the destOpts is null.
